reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great YA historical fiction (and good for younger teens too)!
reviews.reviewText: I read this book with my twelve year old daughter, and we were both captivated by Anna's coming-of-age journey. This book weaves together many interesting perspectives and gives a very non-romanticized accounting of the limited options for women in the late 19th Century as well as the deep racism that white settlers held for the Native peoples of the Puget Sound. Anna's struggle to find her own truth despite the messages that she receives from both her family and society at large feels authentic and also welcome. My daughter and I had some great conversations as a result of reading about the things Anna was experiencing.McGillen does a great job with setting, both in terms of time period and location. It was easy to picture myself in the story, experiencing post-fire Seattle and wondering how we would make it through winter. I would recommend this book especially to people who love the Laura Ingalls books. Anna embodies the independent, pioneering spirit, but she also offers a more nuanced look at what it would have been like to be a smart, determined and capable young woman in society where that wasn't particularly desired and yet was simultaneously changing rapidly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Real Goals and Romance
reviews.reviewText: This story took place in the 1890s, included a mystery, family trying to plan a young woman's future and indigenous people from the Northwest. I enjoyed the young woman's bravery, goals, eagerness to learn, friendliness, especially with the indigenous woman. She knows what life she wants, the kind of man she wants as a husband. I really enjoyed learning the back story of the riddle she solves, what happened to treasure, and how she made money. Very interesting story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really liked this book. The characters were wonderful. The sense of place - made me feel like I was there. I wouldn't be surprised if Anna wasn't scripted after a real life woman in history. Beautifully written. I look foward to the next book in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful story of overcoming others' expectations
reviews.reviewText: Anna lived in a time when women were "expected" to stay home and be "good little wives", taking care of their family. There is not a thing wrong with doing that as long as it is a woman's preference. However, it is not the preference of every woman. Anna was a brave, determined young woman and was willing to risk everything to live out her dream. I wish I'd had that kind of determination and not been so afraid to venture far from the " nest". My life would have been so much richer and I would not have made so many critical mistakes! I can only applaud Anna's efforts to become who she really was. I highly recommend this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Be true to yourself!
reviews.reviewText: Sweet love story that revolves around women's rights and evolves around a woman's needs. This is such an inspiration for young people, both men and women, as it shows that it is okay to be true to yourself and find a mate who is more than okay with that, too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A pleasant fast read
reviews.reviewText: It held my attention from the very beginning. Anna is such a strong young woman who refuses to give up her dreams for social norms. She choses her friends for who they are and not how others view them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet Historical Fiction
reviews.reviewText: Jamie did a stellar job at writing this sweet, historical fiction novel! As a local to the area that the book is set, I found it fascinating to learn more through a story format. The main character is determined and unexpected. Her unlikely friendships with and Indian woman and a childhood friend turned prostitute only added to the depth of Jamie's main character. The love story woven throughout was icing on the cake to an intriguing story!I am really looking forward to diving into the second and third books next!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2021
reviews.reviewText: It was a nice read.Interesting back ground stories. Anyone interested in mountains and the great outdoors, would like this story
